group_1.narration: It seems like none of you have any idea@what I'm talking about.

group_1.textLeft: (...It's alright. I can do this.)
Gathered with us are the leaders of those@who oppose the Mongols…
And all of the rebel forces.
They're all yours.

group_1.textRight: All yours…?@Are you selling us out, Lama?!

group_1.textLeft: What do you think?@At least try using your brain.

group_1.textRight: Nnh…

group_1.textLeft: My apologies, General.@These are the fools I've been dealing with…
Completely and utterly useless.

group_1.narration: I can't stop here, even with this sharp pain@cutting through my chest.
Come to me…@I'll sow the seeds for you.

group_1.textRight: …What are you playing at?

group_1.textLeft: Playing? [chara:105101:lipSynch_0][wait:0.8][chara:105101:cheek_0][chara:105101:face_mtn_ex_010.exp3.json][chara:105101:lipSynch_1]Oh no. All this time, I've been acting.
Did you really think I could smile sincerely@with these useless heaps lying around?

group_1.textRight: Heruka, why are you saying this…?
You…must be lying, right?

group_1.textLeft: See? Even at this point, they're still blabbering@things like this…
You've all been betrayed.@You need to understand this.

group_1.textRight: …What do you mean?@Why are you lying all of a sudden?

group_1.textLeft: I'm not lying.@I'm telling the truth.

group_1.textRight: I don't believe you…

group_1.narration: I never dared make it obvious, but the Rakshasi@always lurked within my heart.

group_1.textLeft: Come, General. Arrest these people,
and leave the rest to me.
I'll have all of Tibet conquered within@just a few days.

group_1.narration: Come… Hurry and cooperate with me.@Didn't you say that Mongolia was also suffering?
Don't you have the perfect excuse to end the war@dangling in front of your face?
You who sits behind the curtain…@Surely you must know my true intentions.
As a member of the royal family,@you're surely very good at this kind of game.

group_1.textCenter: …It is you who should be arrested,@Lama Heruka.

group_1.narration: Yes, he caught on…!

group_1.textRight: Wh-who's that?

group_1.textLeft: I swore I heard a voice from behind@that curtain?

group_1.textRight: Such insolence!
That man is the commander of the@Tibetan Expeditionary Force…
The prince second in line to the throne@of the Mongolian Empire, Köden Khan!

group_1.textLeft: The Prince…

group_1.textRight: …of the Mongolian Empire.

group_1.narration: "Dolo'adai, I still believe in the teachings,@and I read the scriptures every night."
"Last night, I read of demonic witches@who deceive the people,"
"and Heruka is exactly like them…@The Rakshasi."

group_1.textLeft: *Gasp*

group_1.textRight: Rakshasi… So it's true.

group_1.narration: "The Rakshasi are responsible for this war…@They are the ones who have misled the people@and stolen so many innocent lives."
"People of Tibet!@Join us, and together we shall take@our vengeance on the Rakshasi!"
"We will be courteous to those who join us in arms…@and assure them of the same governance as before."

group_1.textLeft: In other words…you will no longer interfere@with our internal affairs?

group_1.narration: "Together, we shall form an imperial federation…@That should be sufficient understanding."

group_1.textRight: A-are you sure about this?
While it's true we originally didn't interfere@much with their internal affairs…
From the way you speak, it sounds as though@you treat the Tibetans as if they were equals…

group_1.narration: "You hear correctly."
"To avenge evil and come to peace together…"
"Isn't that enough?"

group_1.textLeft: (Heh…)

group_1.narration: No. Even though this is going as expected,@I shouldn't dare laugh.
Right… Mongolia was looking for any means@to silence the devotees that were@giving them so much trouble.
To that end, making me a demon and not a savior@would have been the ideal way to ensure this.
That's why Köden is offering me all@of these concessions.
If I submit myself and die...@Tibet will be saved.
Oh thank goodness…@It looks like I managed to succeed.

group_1.textLeft: "The Rakshasi will end the war…"
"She will meet her death as a Rakshasi…"
…No, it can't be…!
…You realized?

group_1.textRight: It came to me when we were researching@the scriptures…
But…I didn't expect it to turn out like this…
ENOUGH OF THIS!

group_1.textLeft: Dolma…

group_1.textRight: This "Rakshasi" thing or whatever you're@talking about…
Heruka isn't anything like that!@There's no way!

group_1.textLeft: It is true she has mysterious powers.
It makes more sense that she was really@a Rakshasi, not the savior.

group_1.textRight: The head priest… You…
With Heruka gone, your order will be free@to rule Tibet…
That's what this is about, isn't it?
That's right, Heruka is a bigger threat to the@Order of the White Hills than Mongolia.
So that's… That's it, right?@That's why you called the head priest here.
Did you want a voice on the Tibetan side@that would make you look bad?
You did this to protect us!
And hey...what's so evil about that?

group_1.narration: Dolma...I knew from the beginning@that you would resist this.
That's why I had to take steps@to make sure you stayed quiet…

group_1.textRight: Excuse me!@A witness has arrived to testify.

group_1.textLeft: A witness? Who could that be?

group_1.textRight: A witness who claims that they can speak@all about Heruka's misdeeds.

group_1.textLeft: I-it's you…

group_1.textCenter: I was once the Lama of their nunnery.
That is…until Heruka tried to kill me.
